revised_title: Anatomy and Comparison of Dugong, Two-Horned Rhinoceros, and Sumatran Tapir Skeletons
tldr: The author describes the unique skeletal structures of the dugong, two-horned rhinoceros, and Sumatran tapir, comparing their bones and internal organs. The dugong's skeleton resembles a boat without a keel, while the tapir's skull has a broader frontal bone and larger nasal bones. The study provides insights into the anatomy and physiology of these three distinct mammals.
